summary: This is a US Department of Justice Public Corruption Unit case update detailing significant developments in the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell. It covers her indictment, arrest, detention, discovery production, bail denials, pretrial motions, and efforts to interview Prince Andrew via an MLAT request.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged in a six-count indictment for facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minor girls; arrested and detained; multiple bail applications denied.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Prosecutors are pursuing a potential interview; after his counsel declined a voluntary interview, prosecutors initiated an MLAT request.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Denied Maxwell's pretrial motions but deferred ruling on a suppression motion related to materials obtained via subpoena to a law firm.

connections.description: Prosecutors are pursuing an interview with Prince Andrew as part of the investigation into Maxwell's case, indicating a perceived connection relevant to the investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A grand jury returned a six-count indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell for her role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minor girls.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested at a residence in New Hampshire.

events.title: Initial Discovery Production
events.description: The prosecution team made an initial discovery production.

events.title: Second Bail Application Denied
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's second bail application was denied.

events.title: Pretrial Motions Filed
events.description: Maxwell's defense filed pretrial motions including motions to dismiss the indictment based on the NPA or statute of limitations, and motions to suppress materials.

events.title: Prosecution Files Omnibus Brief
events.description: The prosecution team filed an omnibus brief in opposition to the defendant's pretrial motions.

events.title: Third Bail Motion Filed and Denied on Appeal
events.description: Maxwell filed a third bail motion; her bail appeal to the Second Circuit was denied.

events.title: Case Status Update
events.description: Trial adjourned to fall 2021; Judge Nathan denied pretrial motions but deferred ruling on a suppression motion.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was indicted on June 29, 2020, on six counts related to facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minor girls.
Maxwell has been detained since her arrest on July 2, 2020, and multiple bail applications have been denied, including an appeal to the Second Circuit.
Prosecutors are pursuing an interview with Prince Andrew and, after his counsel declined a voluntary interview, have initiated an MLAT request.
Pretrial motions include attempts to dismiss the indictment based on a Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) or statute of limitations, and to suppress materials obtained via subpoena.
The trial has been adjourned to the fall of 2021, and the prosecution is working on a second discovery production of electronic materials.
